Posted By: Marchangel (5/7/2011 6:12:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's not like green's not going to play [Beast Within](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beast Within), heh? Who's complaining that BW is more versatile and, therefore, more likely to be played in large numbers? No one. What makes JTMS great? Versatility. Obliterator is just a "unblockable" beatstick. It fills a very narrow role, in a very limited number of decks. It's not going to pop all over the place and warp the metagame.  
  
I think Wizards realized that as long as they provided a healthy amount of removal for all colors, it was okay to make powerful and flashy creatures. And we're benefiting from it. The whole game thrives on cool creatures with nifty abilities. It's like DnD at higher levels: you can do great things and you feel awesome doing them, but your enemies can do a lot too, so the balance (usually) remains. Everybody's happy. Or should be.
posts.html:

Versatility. Obliterator is just a "unblockable" beatstick. It fills a very narrow role, in a very limited number of decks. It's not going to pop all over the place and warp the metagame.

I think Wizards realized that as long as they provided a healthy amount of removal for all colors, it was okay to make powerful and flashy creatures. And we're benefiting from it. The whole game thrives on cool creatures with nifty abilities. It's like DnD at higher levels: you can do great things and you feel awesome doing them, but your enemies can do a lot too, so the balance (usually) remains. Everybody's happy. Or should be.

posts.post_content: Well I guess we'll stop seeing so much action from [Tower of Calamities](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tower of Calamities). This guy makes my heart frown (which is rather painful). He works well in any format, you can 'obliterate" your opponent's face 1v1, He stops blanket damage from red in multi-player formats (from inferno and such if anyone fancies those), and he all but guarantees that NO ONE will attack you in free for all games. I doubt you'll see much saccing action unless your the type to use shenanigans such as [Nemesis Mask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nemesis Mask) and the like.

posts.post_content:
To deal with this you need:  
Deathtouch  
Non-damage removal (exile, destroy, -X/-X, into-library, bounce)  
Damage redirection (lawl)  
Ablative Permanents or Health (I.E. don't deal with it)  
Mind control  
Stifle  
Creature becomes X/Y and loses all abilities  
Counters  
Abilities that do any of the above  
Maybe more stuff.  
  
  
I kinda dislike this card flavor wise. Why is it the best against Red? It should be better against enemy colors, not a friendly color. As it stands red has the least of the above (has less health, has less permanents, has less non-damage removal (basically non), and pretty much only wins by dealing damage. Flavor wise I think it's pretty unfair that this makes red suffer so badly while leaving the other colors in relative safety.   
  
Funny enough, I imagine if I thought i'd see this as red, I'd throw in the temporary mind control effects, letting the black player kill himself with it (because against red he's quite possibly low health.)  
  
All that said, I'm still looking for how ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Increasing the CMC of a [Phyrexian Negator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Negator) by one apparently allows changing his drawback into an equally big advantage...given of course that you change the color of the expansion symbol to orange, too.  
  
Sigh, yet another one of those ridiculous mythic rares.  
Red and green can suck on that one. *(Or rather, their side will get completely sucked through this card.)*  
  
This dude at least shouldn't be able to block, so players could try to stomp their mono-black opponent over before he does...  
  
Amazing flavor thoguh.

Posted By: DeathDark (5/10/2011 2:26:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
This card poses so many problems.  
  
- Should a red player simply absorb 5 a turn? Or risk losing 6 permanents by double Lightning Bolting it?  
- Token-heavy decks cannot simply chump block it due to trample. Eldrazi tokens, with 0 power, may actually help stave off the sacrifice ability, but not the trample unless you throw 5 at it.  
- Huge creatures cannot successfully block it their controller without sustaining serious economic sacrifice. This is the first creature in recent memory that punishes damage overkill.  
- [Guard Gomozoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guard Gomozoa), while a great defender, can only neutralize 3 of its damage due to trample, unless you somehow reduce its power.  
- Ironically, black may have a hard time dealing with this due to its immunity to [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror)s and [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)s if the user doesn't factor it in. Maybe [Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember) will become more popular?
posts.html:
This card poses so many problems.

- Should a red player simply absorb 5 a turn? Or risk losing 6 permanents by double Lightning Bolting it?
- Token-heavy decks cannot simply chump block it due to trample. Eldrazi tokens, with 0 power, may actually help stave off the sacrifice ability, but not the trample unless you throw 5 at it.
- Huge creatures cannot successfully block it their controller without sustaining serious economic sacrifice. This is the first creature in recent memory that punishes damage overkill.
- Guard Gomozoa, while a great defender, can only neutralize 3 of its damage due to trample, unless you somehow reduce its power.
- Ironically, black may have a hard time dealing with this due to its immunity to Terrors and Doom Blades if the user doesn't factor it in. Maybe Dismember will become more popular?

[Incite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incite) finally has purpose!!! xD Make your opponent attack into Obliterator!!!

Then again, if B/R vampires can do it, I'm sure someone else can too.
